Quickstride brings aboard Rattrap and Straight Shot onto his back as he tro=
ts back up to Leo Prime.

 "Well do Sir, right beside ya.  I wonder what ki=
nd of a mood we'll find Tucson in..  You know how much he hates it when Hyd=
ras makes a mess of things, imagine what he's gonna be like if he has ta de=
al with a second nemesis.  And then there's this thing about Rodimus..  Tha=
t is so gonna put him over the edge.  And you really don't wanna see an ang=
ry dragon when he's in the worst of his moods."

Straight Shot nods.

" No,=
 we don't .  I hope Rodimus tries to explain himself gradually around my br=
other because if he plows into him about it, yeah, Tucson will snap, and we=
 don't want that.  But if he waits and thinks about how to explain in a civ=
il manner, Tucson will listen to him.  But if he says he can not be trusted=
 with the Matrix, then his request to hand it over has ta be honored, and i=
t can only be given to Leo Prime as he requests."

Rattrap cocks his head c=
uriously.

" Why can't Wings hold onto it?  He's earned that right more tha=
n a few times.  He put his life on the line for everyone and he gave his al=
l ta Silverbolt when he didn't even have enough for himself.  So why doesn'=
t he deserve that honor?"

Straight Shot looks to him.

" Good question, he=
 never said why he didn't feel that he deserved to have the Matrix.  But he=
 wants Leo Prime to hold onto it so we have to honor his request. "

Quicks=
tride nods.

" Come to think of it, I kind of remember seeing a lot of dama=
ge to the walls of that cave the first time we went in to scope it out.  It=
 looked like a large animal was taking his anger out on the walls.  That ol=
d dragon must've had a really baaaad temper and he didn't want to take it o=
ut on any other creature but himself.  And now, Tucson is the Silver Dragon=
, temper and all.  So he probably feels that his flaws aren't worth the hon=
or of the Matrix."

Don't be envious of what you don't have, be grateful fo=
r things you already posses.  Nothing is worth more than family and friends=
.

On Nov 30, 2011, at 1:40 AM, "adamsafran" <adamsafran@...> wrote:
=

> 
> > 
> > LEO PRIME gave HYDRAS a surprised look, but then shook his hea=
d,
> > "Fine." he said. Looking over at SANTON, QUICKSTRIDE, STRAIGHSHOT an=
d
> > RAT TRAP as he pointed, "You four are with me." LEO was already
> > l=
ooking in the direction they needed to go. Even though the foliage
> > and =
such blocked the view after only a few yards, it was as if he
> > could see=
 the direction they needed to take..
> > 
> > "Good!" TORCA said as he stro=
de forward. "We can finally get moving."
> > 
> > BANTOR grunted, "What has=
 me curious is where is Grimlock? Shouldn't
> > he be out here protecting h=
is territory or something?"
> > 
> > AIRHAMMER and NOCTORRO nodded as they =
looked around, "You're right."
> > NOCTORRO said. "There's more going then =
we know."
> > 
> >
> 
> For the moment, DINOBOT was aboveground in his beas=
t mode, waiting for an opportunity to gut Rattrap should it present itself.=

> 
> Meanwhile, VICE GRIP was still underground, TUNNELING along with DRIL=
L BIT, hopefully unseen by all and using short range sensors to keep track =
of their brethren up above the surface, invisible to all but thsoe with sei=
smic sensors attuned underground.
> 
> WASPIANTOR was managing to fly throu=
gh the thick foilage efficiently, being a surprisingly agile flier even wit=
h a heavy load of eqiupment, able to cautiously avoid the branches and thic=
kness.
> 
> And still stealthed, perhaps unseen by all was BLACKARACHNIA fo=
llowing within the shadows, leaping from tree to tree.
> 
> 

--Apple-Mail-9B73C559-B434-4296-984E-9D161A50F6D5

<br>

You're right."<br>

r>

<br>
For the moment, DINOBOT was aboveground in his b=
east mode, waiting for an opportunity to gut Rattrap should it present itse=
lf.<br>
<br>
Meanwhile, VICE GRIP was still underground, TUNNELING along wi=
th DRILL BIT, hopefully unseen by all and using short range sensors to keep=
 track of their brethren up above the surface, invisible to all but thsoe w=
ith seismic sensors attuned underground.<br>
<br>
WASPIANTOR was managing t=
o fly through the thick foilage efficiently, being a surprisingly agile fli=
er even with a heavy load of eqiupment, able to cautiously avoid the branch=
es and thickness.<br>
<br>
And still stealthed, perhaps unseen by all was B=
LACKARACHNIA following within the shadows, leaping from tree to tree.<br>
